overview: A short promo video from 101 Skateboards featuring Adam McNatt, Andy Stone, Eric Koston, Gabriel Rodriguez. After a brief opening with allusions to the Joel Schumacher film "Falling Down" set to David Bowie's "Panic in Detroit" we get brief sections for all the skaters. Stone skates to a clip of Andrew Dice Clay's "Mother Goose" stand-up sketch, Rodriguez's footage is cut to "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band," McNatt's section features Deee-Lite's "Groove is in the Heart" and Koston closes out the video with a set featuring Gang Starr's "Now You're Mine."
tagline: A Tale of Urban Reality (The Instructional Tape)
title: 101 - Falling Down
